intro: Clibadium leiocarpum, commonly known as the yellow sycamore, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces woody fruits that contain seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
